item.title: Heather add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "For where all love is, the speaking is unnecessary" -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Heather add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Heather add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Heather add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "When we hope, we usually hope for the wrong thing." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Heather add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Heather add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A short story is a different thing all together - a short story is like a kiss in the dark from a stranger." -- Stephen King

item.title: Heather add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I'm having a magenta day. Not just red, but magenta!" -- Stephen King

item.title: Heather add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Heather add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Heather add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Heather add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Heather add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Heather add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "People are stupid. They will believe a lie because they want to believe it's true, or because they are afraid it might be true." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Heather add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "I often hear people say that they read to escape reality, but I believe that what they’re really doing is reading to find reason for hope, to find strength. While a bad book leaves readers with a sense of hopelessness and despair, a good novel, through stories of values realized, of wrongs righted, can bring to readers a connection to the wonder of life. A good novel shows how life can and ought to be lived. It not only entertains but energizes and uplifts readers." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Heather add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description:
"The Screelings are loose and the Keeper may win. His assassins have come to rip off your skin. Golden eyes will see you if you try to run. The screelings will get you and laugh like it's fun.
Walk away slow or they'll tear you apart, and laugh all day long as they rip out your heart. Golden eyes will see you if you try to stand still. The screelings will get you, for the Keeper they kill.
Hack 'em up, chop 'em up, cut 'em to bits, or else they will get you while laughing in fits. If the screelings don't get you the Keeper will try, to reach out and touch you, your skin he will fry.
Your mind he will flail, your soul he will take. You'll sleep with the dead, for life you'll forsake. You'll die with the Keeper till the end of time. He hates that you live, your life is the crime.
The screelings might get you, it says so in text. If screelings don't get you the Keeper is next, lest he who's born true can fight for life's bond. And that one is marked; he's the pebble in the pond." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Heather add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "Right and wrong are not the product of census." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Heather add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "The Second Rule is that the greatest harm can result from the best intentions. It sounds a paradox, but kindness and good intentions can be an insidious path to destruction. Sometimes doing what seems right is wrong, and can cause harm. The only counter to it is knowledge, wisdom, forethought, and understanding the First Rule. Even then, that is not always enough." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Heather add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Heather add a quote by Erin Hunter
item.description: "You cannot live with a paw in each world." -- Erin Hunter

item.title: Heather add a quote by Erin Hunter
item.description: "There will be three, kin of your kin, who hold the power of the stars in their paws." -- Erin Hunter

item.title: Heather add a quote by Erin Hunter
item.description: "I forgot it" -- Erin Hunter

item.title: Heather add a quote by Erin Hunter
item.description: "Four will Become Two, Lion and Tiger will Meet in Battle, and Blood will Rule the Forest." -- Erin Hunter

item.title: Heather add a quote by Erin Hunter
item.description: "Fire will save the Clan" -- Erin Hunter

item.title: Heather add a quote by Patricia Cornwell
item.description: "Do no harm & leave the world a better place than you found it." -- Patricia Cornwell

item.title: Heather add a quote by Alison Weir
item.description: "I prefer to be left alone with my books." -- Alison Weir

item.title: Heather add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Heather add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "<i>I</i> care for myself. The more solitary, the more friendless, the more unsustained I am, the more I will respect myself." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Heather add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Heather add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Flirting is a woman’s trade, one must keep in practice." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Heather add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Here’s to books, the cheapest vacation you can buy." -- Charlaine Harris
